attributes.action: Place a Zebra crossing in Watling Street
attributes.additional_details:
Watling Steet, by Dartford Fire Station, is a very busy stretch of road. 

There are many families having to use this road daily, especially going to and from a local school, and there are NO SAFE places to cross this road.

A Zebra crossing would be extremely beneficial to this neighbourhood.
attributes.background: Due to the high volume of traffic this busy stretch of needs a zebra crossing.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local road improvements are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council directly. Find out how to petition your council here: https://democracy.kent.gov.uk/mgepetitionlistdisplay.aspx?bcr=1
